column4: I was hoping somebody could help this newbie compile a tarball.
I have the source code for the latest version of gnucash.
I downloaded it and extracted all of the files onto my desktop (why not?).
I do ./configure and I get "configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables"
did you install build esentials?
look like it you will need to install that perl module first.
Thought I did.  Lemme look.
According to Synaptic, I have the latest version of perl installed (5.8.7-10ubuntu1), as well as perl-base.  There are some other perl things I could install, like -byacc, debug, doc.
you might have to install the module manually I don't know much about perl modules to tell if it is in a package.
I hope you are wrong.  I'll let you know in a minute.
did you try just "./configure"
BRILLIANT! ./configure was the way to go.
now for MAKE.
good :)
I have to admit, I'm feeling pretty dim right now.  Make has no make targets.  Do I just say 'make'?
generally, is there a README file?
Yes, but it's not helping.
by not making any targets what did it say.
Aaah.. Should have read better.  Readme says it uses GNU Automake .. ?\
what do you get with "make --version"
GNU Make 3.81beta4
good,  what was the command you used ?
